poemContent: 🇺🇦 Ukraine: Hey guys, could we get some reinforcements?🇺🇸 Second Officer: Look sir, we can't, it's too dangerou-🇺🇸 Captain: Unleash it.Helicopters blast the hair off the poles,as they speed over the border of Ukraine,Rotors at MAX rpm, swerving from leftto right, as they carry a heavy load below.Fastened by carabiners and ropes of steel,Chinhooks, apaches, jets and more,guiding the weapon of colossal destruction tothe killing place.In Kyiv now, and as the red sun starts to set,beauty for a moment, as each rope falls slack,a huge shadow casting over each apartment in darkness,the children hidden in the bunkers draw close to the cracks, in the walls,to observe as the colossal giant, in wonderslowly descends with the force of a thousand nukes,an eir of insatiable tranquility for the few moments before impact, as the orange sunset light falls behind...Then a shock wave, throwing them under rubble,as buildings collapse in the feverish heat of the impact, uprooting every tank and gunner,a colossal divot forms, ripping and devouring the flesh of the earth,like EDP taking a bite into daughter nature's cupcake, after luring it into the deceitful wake of his destruction,and exploding in the centre of the town.🇺🇸 Second Officer: I'lll be the first to say that I was wrong, good work, Cap'n.Hiroshima, Nagasaki🇺🇸 Captain: I mean, we do God's work upholding democracy.Little of Ukraine yet remains.Same case with Afghanistan, Syria and that other place.🇺🇸 Second Officer: Wait, so who were we fighting again this time, the Russians?Ready to deploy the EDP again.
